hoomd.cavitymd.analysis¶

Analysis and tracking components for cavity molecular dynamics simulations.

Functions

compute_density_field(snapshot, wavevectors)

Compute density field ρ(k) for given wavevectors.

compute_total_dipole_moment(snapshot)

Compute total dipole moment with proper position unwrapping.

generate_fibonacci_sphere([samples])

Generate uniformly distributed points on a sphere using Fibonacci spiral.

Classes

AutocorrelationTracker(simulation, observable)

Generic autocorrelation tracker for simple observables.

BaseTracker(simulation[, time_tracker, ...])

Base class for all tracking components with common infrastructure.

CavityModeTracker(simulation, cavityforce[, ...])

Track cavity mode properties and energies (specialized tracker).

DipoleAutocorrelation(simulation[, ...])

Dipole autocorrelation tracker - convenience wrapper around AutocorrelationTracker.

ElapsedTimeTracker(simulation, runtime)

Track elapsed simulation time in physical units and exit when runtime is reached.

EnergyTracker(simulation, components[, ...])

Energy tracking that exactly follows the working EnergyContributionTracker pattern.

FieldAutocorrelationTracker(simulation, ...)

Generic autocorrelation tracker for field observables with k-space averaging.

Status(simulation, chartime[, time_tracker])

Status monitoring for cavity MD simulations.

TimestepFormatter(integrator)

Format timestep information for logging.
hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.compute_total_dipole_moment(snapshot)[source]¶

Compute total dipole moment with proper position unwrapping.

hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.compute_density_field(snapshot, wavevectors)[source]¶

Compute density field ρ(k) for given wavevectors.

hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.generate_fibonacci_sphere(samples=100)[source]¶

Generate uniformly distributed points on a sphere using Fibonacci spiral.

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.BaseTracker(simulation, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='tracker', output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Base class for all tracking components with common infrastructure.

__init__(simulation, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='tracker', output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Initialize base tracker.

Parameters:

  • simulation – HOOMD simulation object

  • time_tracker – Optional time tracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps (NOT time-based)

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.AutocorrelationTracker(simulation, observable, time_tracker=None, output_prefix=None, output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Generic autocorrelation tracker for simple observables.

__init__(simulation, observable, time_tracker=None, output_prefix=None, output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Initialize autocorrelation tracker.

Parameters:

  • simulation – HOOMD simulation object

  • observable – Observable name from SIMPLE_OBSERVABLES

  • time_tracker – Optional time tracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps

compute_autocorr(current_value)[source]¶

Compute autocorrelation C(t) = observable(0)·observable(t).

act(timestep)[source]¶

Performs whatever action a subclass implements.

Parameters:

timestep (int) – The current timestep in a simulation.

Note

Use self._state to access the simulation state via hoomd.State when using the base class attach.

property current_autocorr¶

category=”scalar”)

Type:

(Loggable <hoomd.logging.Logger>

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.FieldAutocorrelationTracker(simulation, observable, time_tracker=None, output_prefix=None, output_period_steps=1000, reference_interval_steps=10000, max_references=10, **kwargs)[source]¶

Generic autocorrelation tracker for field observables with k-space averaging.

__init__(simulation, observable, time_tracker=None, output_prefix=None, output_period_steps=1000, reference_interval_steps=10000, max_references=10, **kwargs)[source]¶

Initialize field autocorrelation tracker.

Parameters:

  • simulation – HOOMD simulation object

  • observable – Observable name from FIELD_OBSERVABLES

  • time_tracker – Optional time tracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps

  • reference_interval_steps – Interval between new references in steps

  • max_references – Maximum number of reference states to keep

  • **kwargs – Observable-specific parameters

compute_field_autocorr(field0, field_t)[source]¶

Compute field autocorrelation.

act(timestep)[source]¶

Performs whatever action a subclass implements.

Parameters:

timestep (int) – The current timestep in a simulation.

Note

Use self._state to access the simulation state via hoomd.State when using the base class attach.

property current_autocorr¶

category=”scalar”)

Type:

(Loggable <hoomd.logging.Logger>

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.EnergyTracker(simulation, components, force_objects=None, thermostat_objects=None, kinetic_tracker=None, cavity_mode_tracker=None, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='energy', output_period_steps=1000, max_timesteps=None, compute_temperature=True, track_reservoirs=True)[source]¶

Energy tracking that exactly follows the working EnergyContributionTracker pattern.

KEY FIXES to match working code:

  1. Direct Force Energy Access: Use direct .energy access like working code, no complex force computation initialization

  2. Separate Kinetic Trackers: Use separate kinetic energy trackers instead of computing from snapshot (matches working code architecture)

  3. Simple Error Handling: Use simple AttributeError/DataAccessError handling like working code, not complex initialization

  4. Exact Universe Total Calculation: Follow working code’s exact calculation: universe_total = system_total + total_thermostat_energy

  5. Extensive Debug Output: Add comprehensive debugging to identify issues

__init__(simulation, components, force_objects=None, thermostat_objects=None, kinetic_tracker=None, cavity_mode_tracker=None, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='energy', output_period_steps=1000, max_timesteps=None, compute_temperature=True, track_reservoirs=True)[source]¶

Initialize corrected energy tracker following working code pattern.

Parameters:

  • simulation – HOOMD simulation object

  • components – List of energy components to track

  • force_objects – Dictionary of force objects (harmonic, lj, ewald_short, ewald_long, cavity)

  • thermostat_objects – Dictionary of thermostat/method objects for reservoir energy

  • kinetic_tracker – KineticEnergyTracker object (like working code)

  • cavity_mode_tracker – CavityModeTracker object (like working code)

  • time_tracker – ElapsedTimeTracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps

  • max_timesteps – Maximum timesteps to track

  • compute_temperature – Whether to compute temperature

  • track_reservoirs – Whether to track reservoir energies

act(timestep)[source]¶

Main energy computation method following working code pattern exactly.

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.ElapsedTimeTracker(simulation, runtime)[source]¶

Track elapsed simulation time in physical units and exit when runtime is reached.

Update the total elapsed time by accumulating time increments.

Expose the total elapsed time as a property in (ps).

Current timestep size in femtoseconds.

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.CavityModeTracker(simulation, cavityforce, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='cavity_mode', output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

  • cavityforce – Cavity force object to track

  • time_tracker – Optional time tracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps

class hoomd.cavitymd.analysis.DipoleAutocorrelation(simulation, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='dipole_autocorr', output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Dipole autocorrelation tracker - convenience wrapper around AutocorrelationTracker.

This class provides backward compatibility for the DipoleAutocorrelation class that was previously defined in the monolithic cavitymd.py file.

__init__(simulation, time_tracker=None, output_prefix='dipole_autocorr', output_period_steps=1000)[source]¶

Initialize dipole autocorrelation tracker.

Parameters:

  • simulation – HOOMD simulation object

  • time_tracker – Optional time tracker for accurate timing

  • output_prefix – Prefix for output files

  • output_period_steps – Output frequency in simulation steps
